# LLMNR Poisoning
## Disclaimer
The scenarios listed in this directory are directly taken from Heath Adams (The Cyber Mentor) in his "Zero to Hero" course.
## Notes
- LLMNR Poisoning = NBT-NS Poisoning
- Link Local Multicast Name Resolution, Netios Name services
- Used to find host when dns fails
- Both services utilize username and hash
- Also using this when connecting to share

Attack 1:
- Find hash
- Crack


Attack 2:
- Relay NTLM hash
- Never crack it


## Responder
Should always be running
`python Responder.py -I eth0 -wrFb`

## Hash
This hash came through when trying to log into the attacker from victim
`tstark::MARVEL:9d1e91698c2c27c2:F7ECDC9538D0C67DF12E790BCC7A45A7:`

## Defense Strategies
- Prevention: Disable LLMNR and NBT-NS
Other course of action:
- Require network access control
- Require strong user passwords
